Description: Hollow-cast figure of a walking bull in copper alloy; crowned with a sun disc and uraeus in front; probably associated with Apis; lower part of forelegs and back legs damaged; corroded.
Curator's comments: Bronze figures of Apis were common during the Late and Ptolemaic periods, principally in the Memphite region where was his main cult centre, with only a few attestations on other Delta sites such as Bubastis and Herakleion (Roeder 1956, § 411-413; Weiss 2012, 293-295). This bull figure belongs to the type T 28 in the typology of figure bronzes by K. Weiss (Weiss 2012, 293-294, 758-779, Taf. 47, Typ T 28, see Nr. 925 for this specimen), depicting the Apis bull walking on a base. The latter is usually mounted on a further base in the form of sledge (Weiss 2012, 294). Other figures of bull are known from Naukratis: Oxford, Ashmolean Museum AN1896-1908-EA.688; Boston, Museum of Fine Arts 86.260 and 86.300. Roeder, G. 1956, Ägyptische Bronzefiguren, Mitteilungen aus der Ägyptischen Sammlung 6, Berlin. Weiss, K. 2012, Ägyptische Tier- und Götterbronzen aus Unterägypten: Untersuchungen zu Typus, Ikonographie und Funktion sowie der Bedeutung innerhalb der Kulturkontakte zu Griechenland, Ägypten und Altes Testament 81.
Bibliographic references: Weiss 2012 / Ägyptische Tier- und Götterbronzen aus Unterägypten : Untersuchungen zu Typus, Ikonographie und Funktion sowie der Bedeutung innerhalb der Kulturkontakte zu Griechenland (p. 768, Nr. 925)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (MB.202) (phase 3)
